required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study Evaluating Venetoclax in Combination With Azacitidine Compared With Azacitidine Alone in Participants With Higher-Risk Myelodysplastic Syndromes (MDS) After Hypomethylating Agent-Failure
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1b Study Evaluating the Safety, Pharmacokinetics and Efficacy of Venetoclax as a Single-Agent and in Combination With Azacitidine in Subjects With Higher-Risk Myelodysplastic Syndromes After Hypomethylating Agent-Failure

brief_summary.textblock: This is a Phase 1b, dose-ranging, open-label, multicenter study designed to evaluate the safety, pharmacokinetics, and efficacy of venetoclax as a single-agent and in combination with azacitidine in participants with higher-risk Myelodysplastic Syndromes (MDS) after Hypomethylating Agent (HMA)-Failure.

detailed_description.textblock: Interventional study design - primary objective: Assess the safety and pharmacokinetics of venetoclax as a single-agent and in combination with azacitidine.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of participants with adverse events
primary_outcome.time_frame: From participants' first dose of study drug until 30 days after the participants' last dose of study drug.
Cycle 1 Day 1, for each escalated new dose, and on Cycle 2 Day 4. (cycle = 28-days)

primary_outcome.measure: Time to Cmax (peak time, Tmax) for venetoclax
primary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1 Day 1, for each escalated new dose, and on Cycle 2 Day 4. (cycle = 28-days)

primary_outcome.measure: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve (AUC) from 0 to the time of the last measurable concentration (AUCt) for venetoclax
primary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1 Day 1, for each escalated new dose, and on Cycle 2 Day 4. (cycle = 28-days)

primary_outcome.measure: AUC over a 24-hour dose interval (AUC[0-24]) for venetoclax
primary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1 Day 1, for each escalated new dose, and on Cycle 2 Day 4. (cycle = 28-days)

primary_outcome.measure: AUC from 0 to infinity (AUC) for azacitidine

primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured from Cycle 1 Day 1 until evidence of MDS progression, the occurrence of unacceptable toxicity, death, exercise of investigator discretion, withdrawal of consent or, if clinically indicated up to 5 years after the last participant enrolled.
primary_outcome.description: ORR (equals the sum of rates of complete remission [CR] + partial remission [PR]) of venetoclax as a single-agent and in combination with azacitidine.

primary_outcome.measure: Recommended Dose (RD) and dosing schedule of venetoclax as a single-agent and in combination with azacitidine
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured from Cycle 1 Day 1 until evidence of MDS progression, the occurrence of unacceptable toxicity, death, exercise of investigator discretion, withdrawal of consent or, if clinically indicated up to 5 years after the last participant enrolled.
primary_outcome.description: In Cohort 1, single agent venetoclax will be evaluated at 2 different dose levels, 400 mg qd and 800 mg qd. Prior to opening Cohort 2, a safety and efficacy review will be conducted after participants in Cohort 1 (N = 12, 6 participants in each arm) have been enrolled and followed for at least 8 weeks.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured from Cycle 1 Day 1 until evidence of MDS progression, the occurrence of unacceptable toxicity, death, exercise of investigator discretion, withdrawal of consent or, if clinically indicated up to 5 years after the last participant enrolled.
secondary_outcome.description: Complete response rate will be defined as the proportion of participants who achieved a complete response per the International Working Group (IWG) criteria for Myelodysplastic Syndromes (MDS).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured from Cycle 1 Day 1 until evidence of MDS progression, the occurrence of unacceptable toxicity, death, exercise of investigator discretion, withdrawal of consent or, if clinically indicated up to 5 years after the last participant enrolled.
secondary_outcome.description: Percentages of participants with HI (erythroid/platelet/neutrophil responses)

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of red blood cell (RBC) transfusion independence
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured from Cycle 1 Day 1 until evidence of MDS progression, the occurrence of unacceptable toxicity, death, exercise of investigator discretion, withdrawal of consent or, if clinically indicated up to 5 years after the last participant enrolled.
secondary_outcome.description: Percentages of participants who become RBC transfusion independent.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured from Cycle 1 Day 1 until evidence of MDS progression, the occurrence of unacceptable toxicity, death, exercise of investigator discretion, withdrawal of consent or, if clinically indicated up to 5 years after the last participant enrolled.
secondary_outcome.description: Percentages of participants who become platelet transfusion-independent.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured from Cycle 1 Day 1 until evidence of MDS progression, the occurrence of unacceptable toxicity, death, exercise of investigator discretion, withdrawal of consent or, if clinically indicated up to 5 years after the last participant enrolled.
secondary_outcome.description: Percentages of participants with cytogenetic response.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of bone marrow blast response
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured from Cycle 1 Day 1 until evidence of MDS progression, the occurrence of unacceptable toxicity, death, exercise of investigator discretion, withdrawal of consent or, if clinically indicated up to 5 years after the last participant enrolled.
secondary_outcome.description: Percentages of participants with a bone marrow blast response.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to transformation to acute myelogenous leukemia (AML)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured from Cycle 1 Day 1 until evidence of MDS progression, the occurrence of unacceptable toxicity, death, exercise of investigator discretion, withdrawal of consent or, if clinically indicated up to 5 years after the last participant enrolled.
secondary_outcome.description: Time to AML transformation will be defined as the number of days from the date of first dose to the date of documented AML transformation, defined as a bone marrow blast count greater than or equal to 30% independent of baseline bone marrow count.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured from Cycle 1 Day 1 until evidence of MDS progression, the occurrence of unacceptable toxicity, death, exercise of investigator discretion, withdrawal of consent or, if clinically indicated up to 5 years after the last participant enrolled.
secondary_outcome.description: DOR is defined as the number of days from the date of first response (CR or PR) to the earliest documentation of progressive disease.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured from Cycle 1 Day 1 until evidence of MDS progression, the occurrence of unacceptable toxicity, death, exercise of investigator discretion, withdrawal of consent or, if clinically indicated up to 5 years after the last participant enrolled.
secondary_outcome.description: OS defined as the number of days from the date of first dose to the date of death.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured from Cycle 1 Day 1 until evidence of MDS progression, the occurrence of unacceptable toxicity, death, exercise of investigator discretion, withdrawal of consent or, if clinically indicated up to 5 years after the last participant enrolled.
secondary_outcome.description: PFS defined as the number of days from the date of first dose to the date of earliest disease progression or death.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to next MDS treatment (TTNT) will be defined as the time from first dose to start of new non-protocol specified MDS therapy.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured from Cycle 1 Day 1 until evidence of MDS progression, the occurrence of unacceptable toxicity, death, exercise of investigator discretion, withdrawal of consent or, if clinically indicated up to 5 years after the last participant enrolled.
secondary_outcome.description: TTNT defined as the time from first dose to start of new non-protocol specified MDS therapy.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured from Cycle 1 Day 1 until evidence of MDS progression, the occurrence of unacceptable toxicity, death, exercise of investigator discretion, withdrawal of consent or, if clinically indicated up to 5 years after the last participant enrolled.
secondary_outcome.description: EFS defined as the number of days from the date of first dose to the date of earliest disease progression, death, or initiation of new non-protocol-specified MDS therapy without documented progression.

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) Cancer Fatigue Short Form (SF) 7a
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured from Cycle 1 Day 1 until evidence of MDS progression, the occurrence of unacceptable toxicity, death, exercise of investigator discretion, withdrawal of consent or, if clinically indicated up to 5 years after the last participant enrolled.

Measured from Cycle 1 Day 1 until evidence of MDS progression, the occurrence of unacceptable toxicity, death, exercise of investigator discretion, withdrawal of consent or, if clinically indicated up to 5 years after the last participant enrolled.

Measured from Cycle 1 Day 1 until evidence of MDS progression, the occurrence of unacceptable toxicity, death, exercise of investigator discretion, withdrawal of consent or, if clinically indicated up to 5 years after the last participant enrolled.
secondary_outcome.description: Global health status/quality of life will be assessed using the GHS/QoL scale from the European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer Quality of Life Questionnaire Core [EORTC QLQ-C30]

arm_group.arm_group_label: Cohort 1 Arm A venetoclax 400 mg once daily (qd)
Cohort 1 Arm B venetoclax 800 mg qd

arm_group.description: Venetoclax 400 or 800 mg qd + azacitidine (75 mg/m2 Days 1 through 7 of each 28-day cycle OR Days 1 through 5 of Week 1 and Days 1 and 2 and of Week 2, including a 2-day break, of each 28-day cycle). Cohort 1, Arms A and B will be used to determine the recommended dose (RD) of venetoclax for Cohort 2.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Study Expansion Cohort venetoclax or venetoclax + azacitidine
arm_group.description: After an aggregate safety and efficacy review of the completed Cohorts 1 and 2, it will be determined whether a study expansion cohort will be opened and which treatment-regimen will be further explored (either single-agent venetoclax 400 mg or 800 mg qd or venetoclax 400 mg or 800 mg qd plus azacitidine).

intervention.arm_group_label: Cohort 1 Arm A venetoclax 400 mg once daily (qd)
Cohort 1 Arm B venetoclax 800 mg qd
Study Expansion Cohort venetoclax or venetoclax + azacitidine

intervention.description: Powder for injection, subcutaneously or intravenous
intervention.arm_group_label: Study Expansion Cohort venetoclax or venetoclax + azacitidine

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participant must have documented diagnosis and classification of Myelodysplastic Syndromes (MDS) with application of the International Prognostic Scoring System (IPSS) as Higher Risk (HR) MDS at the time of first diagnosis with IPSS risk categories Int-2 or High (IPSS overall score greater than or equal to 1.5).
- Participants must have presence of greater than or equal to 5% and less than 30% bone marrow blasts per bone marrow biopsy/aspirate at screening.
- Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance score of less than or equal to 2.
- Participant must have failure of prior therapy with Hypomethylating Agent (HMA) (azacitidine or decitabine) as first-line MDS treatment.
- Participant must have adequate hematologic, renal, and hepatic function.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participant had lower-risk MDS with IPSS risk categories Low or Int-1 (overall IPSS score < 1.5) at the time of first diagnosis.
- Participant has therapy-related MDS (t-MDS).
- Participant has MDS evolving from a pre-existing myeloproliferative neoplasm (MPN).
- Participant has MDS/MPN including chronic myelomonocytic leukemia (CMML), atypical chronic myelogenous leukemia (CML), juvenile myelomonocytic leukemia (JMML) and unclassifiable MDS/MPN.
- Participant has received more than 1 prior therapy.
- Participant has received therapy other than azacitidine or decitabine for the treatment of MDS.
- Participant has received prior therapy with a BH3 mimetic.
- Participant has received hematopoietic growth factors, agents intended to improve blood counts (e.g., erythropoietin, eltrombopag), or corticosteroids within 14 days prior to the first dose of study drug.
